title: Wrong `Clone` bound suggestion

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-invalid-suggestion
labels.description: A structured suggestion resulting in incorrect code

body:
### Code Playground: ```Rust use std::collections::HashMap; #[derive(Clone)] struct Ctx { a_map: HashMap>, } #[derive(Clone)] // help: consider annotating `B` with `#[derive(Clone)]` struct B { // ----------- doesn't satisfy `B: Clone` a: A, } fn foo(ctx: &mut Ctx) { let a_map = ctx.a_map.clone(); // ^^^^^ method cannot be called on `HashMap>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds } ``` ### Current output ```Shell error[E0599]: the method `clone` exists for struct `HashMap>`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied --> src/lib.rs:15:27 | 10 | struct B { | ----------- doesn't satisfy `B: Clone` ... 15 | let a_map = ctx.a_map.clone(); | ^^^^^ method cannot be called on `HashMap>` due to unsatisfied trait bounds | ::: /Users/USERNAME/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-x86_64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/collections/hash/map.rs:214:1 | 214 | pub struct HashMap { | ----------------------------------------- doesn't satisfy `HashMap>: Clone` | = note: the following trait bounds were not satisfied: `B: Clone` which is required by `HashMap>: Clone` help: consider annotating `B` with `#[derive(Clone)]` | 10 | #[derive(Clone)] | For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`. error: could not compile `test_clone_err` (lib) due to previous error warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... error: could not compile `test_clone_err` (lib test) due to previous error ``` ### Desired output ```Shell error[E0599]: the method `clone` exists for mutable reference `&mut Ctx`, but its trait bounds were not satisfied --> src/lib.rs:16:9 | 4 | struct Ctx { | ------------- doesn't satisfy `Ctx: Clone` ... 16 | ctx.clone(); | ^^^^^ method cannot be called on `&mut Ctx` due to unsatisfied trait bounds | note: trait bound `A: Clone` was not satisfied --> src/lib.rs:3:10 | 3 | #[derive(Clone)] | ^^^^^ unsatisfied trait bound introduced in this `derive` macro help: consider restricting the type parameter to satisfy the trait bound | 15 | fn foo(ctx: &mut Ctx) where A: Clone { | ++++++++++++++ For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0599`. error: could not compile `test_clone_err` (lib test) due to previous error warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... error: could not compile `test_clone_err` (lib) due to previous error ``` ### Rationale and extra context The root cause is that `P` in `foo

` has not been restricted by the `Clone` bound, but the compiler suggests users to add `#[derive(Clone)]` on `struct B`, which has already been done. ### Other cases _No response_ ### Anything else? `rustc` versions: ```text rustc 1.70.0-nightly (88fb1b922 2023-04-10) rustc 1.71.0-nightly (d0f204e4d 2023-04-16) ``` I have tested the same code under both of the versions and the outputs are the same.
